title: Why a Proper Retirement Plan in Place is Important? (Saumya Shetty)
text: By Saumya Shetty Oct 1, 2015 Most Indians consider retirement planning important, but only 28% are actually investing. Although there is a growing realization that retirement planning should begin early, Indians don't seem to be doing it till they are 39, says an article published in The Economic Times in August 2013. I am 36 year old software engineer living in Pune. I started to give thought to retirement planning only after I came across this article while browsing the net a year back.What I LearntSixty-three percent of urban Indians feel that they'll have enough money post the working years. But the real question is with ever rising prices, meagre savings and a host of responsibilities, would we really have enough money? Here is what I realized when I started researching for retirement plans.I Should Have Started Early - The earlier you start investing, the more money you save. Also, the more time you give an investment corpus to build, the more benefits you reap. I realized that only after I calculated how much I would have already earned if I had started at 30 or even earlier.I Should Take Care of My Health - Health care costs rose at a double-digit pace between 2005 to 2015 outpacing inflation according to a report published by the National Sample Survey Office. Now that is a very alarming trend. Taking care of our health is probably the most efficient insurance plan we can have in place but due to my tight work schedules, I had not been able to do so. After a series of comprehensive check-ups, I made a conscious effort to eat healthy and exercise. Not only is healthcare cost rising but our health also deteriorates as we age therefore a comprehensive health care policy that covers you and your family is essential to save you from future financial shocks. One thing that I did when I took a retirement plan was that I got my entire family health insured so that I have my earnings covered in case any member of the family falls ill.Pay off Your Home Loan as Early as Possible - I had been re-paying my monthly installments towards my home loan on time for the past 6 years. I have never thought of paying it off early even though I had surplus income every month. This only struck me when I realized that I could pay off my loan sooner and invest the same amount of money every month to my retirement corpus.Take Inflation into Perspective - This is what my adviser told me. Inflation is going to catch up as times passes by, therefore you must take out a retirement plan that can help you maintain your lifestyle with ease even after you have stopped working. About the Author Saumya Shetty is an experienced author with keen interest on Finance and retirement plans topics having a number of articles to her credit based. Rating:
